BLIZZARD: A large snowstorm accompanied by strong winds and greatly reduced visibility caused by blowing snow.
FROST: A cover of minute ice crystals on objects that are exposed to the air. Frost is formed by the same process as dew, except that the temperature of the _____ed object is below freezing.
SLEET: Pellets of ice made of mostly frozen raindrops or refrozen melted snowflakes.
SNOW: The frozen, crystalline state of water that falls as precipitation.
